comments.text: Thank you for the tip on the alfalfa. I had a bag of alfalfa pellets from tractor supply in my cargo container for the sheep last year, but they didn’t like it. I just grabbed some of it out of the bag so I can soak it and give it to the chickens!  😊
comments.author: @chrispaulus4491

comments.text: Where is the black/gray hen you called John/Joanna?
comments.author: @Tanya-m3u3p

comments.text: I collected 9500+ eggs last year. I ate the eggs that were less than 50 g, dirty or otherwise defective. I hard boiled and then fed back to the chickens many eggs during the summer. The barn cat gets one or two eggs a day.  I freeze dried about 100 dozen raw, scrambled eggs. I sold a few dozen, but the rest I gave away. 😊
comments.author: @chrispaulus4491

comments.text:
Doc,

I live in PA and it gets cold but I give my girls cabbages year round. I buy a 50 lb. box from my local Mennonite grocery store for $22.00 this last about 10 days. 

In addition, one of my feeders I put Nutrena NatureWise Harvest blend 18% protein, 40 in bag from Chewy for $22. Read about it. Tractor Supply also carries it.
comments.author: @jamesfolsom2108

comments.text: Thanks for the video Doc
comments.author: @douglasbarnhart3324

comments.text: is the Tractor supply chopped alfalfa ok to give chickens?  I live in SE FL so keeping wet grain or alfalfa is impossible not to mold in a matter of days.

comments.text: This coming summer we’re putting some of our laying hens in chicken tractors and plan to move them through one of our alpha fields.   Should be interesting.
comments.author: @bradmiller6507

comments.text: Where is the black/gray hen you called John/Joanna?
comments.author: @Tanya-m3u3p

comments.text: Health and diet has a lot to do with egg production. Some feed the bare minimum and complain about not having any eggs. I keep the layer feed out all the time and even give them a little Oyster and Grit thrown in their feed as other inputs are available in their run. Water gets 1/8 tsp of Vitamin Electrolyte per gallon and people say my chickens look healthy.. In that cold weather (single digits) I was feeding a mix of scratch and crack corn 2x a day and had a drop in protein and calcium.. Looking at alternatives for greens when nothing is growing.
comments.author: @heavymechanic2

comments.text: is the Tractor supply chopped alfalfa ok to give chickens?  I live in SE FL so keeping wet grain or alfalfa is impossible not to mold in a matter of days.
comments.author: @facingfacts7830
